fixed my reloaded update 9 after dawnguard made it freeze every time the world opened. genuine 1.7 it seems, added new options to the data files menu ('skyrim workshop' shortcut, mod load order) if you haven't read yet the solution for the greyed out 'data files' in the launcher, it is simple and listed below.

or maybe not: to enable the data files option, go into documentsmy gamesskyrimSkyrimPrefs. Scroll down to [Launcher]. Add this third line there, so it looks like this: 
[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=1
uLastAspectRatio=4
bEnableFileSelection=1

save and open the skyrim launcher. data files should be there now. open and select your mods.  incidentally using this fix finally allowed me to use the reloaded high res pack; i had no idea I needed to enable it in this menu. duh

To Kickaris, Dread_naught96, Cairnz and masquemea:
Install patch 1.6 and then copy and paste this exe for patch 1.7!!!!Had the same problem!!

To everyone having the "can't attack" problem:
DO NOT copy any of the .bsa or .esm files from the main folder.  If you have copied those over, make sure they're deleted from your main Skyrim folder, and overwrite the ones in your Data folder with the files in this torrent's Data folder. After that, everything works fine.

seems to work for me, but I haven't figured out how to tell if it's 1.7 yet. I already have mounted combat, so that's not gonna prove anything.

for what it's worth, I'm running the rzr-skrm.iso version of skyrim that TFK uploaded, with the "The.Elder.Scrolls.V.Skyrim.v1.6.89.0.6.Update.9.CRACKED-P2P" 1.6 patch.

for anyone who's worried about this (and anyone installing pirated software SHOULD be cautious), do what I did, make a backup copy of your original TESV.exe before replacing it with this one. that should go without saying, but you never know.

if this doesn't work for you, just remove the new TESV and put the original back.
